jobPostingInfo.title: Systems Engineer IV (MassChange Project V&V Lead)
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

If you are passionate about spacecraft design, we invite you to join the Flight Systems Engineering, Integration and Test Section. We provide systems engineering for the design and implementation of spacecraft for the laboratory’s key flight projects. Our work spans spacecraft systems engineering, payload systems integration, electrical systems integration, fault protection and autonomy design, landing systems design, spacecraft assembly and test, systems verification and validation, and systems modeling.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced engineering leader to serve as the Systems Engineer IV (Lead Project Verification and Validation (V&V) Engineer) for the Mass Change Project. You will report to the Group Supervisor for the System Verification and Validation Group and serve the Project Systems Engineer as your primary technical stakeholder. Your primary responsibility will be to design and carry out a successful verification and validation program of the Mass Change Project within the schedule, budget, and risk profile.

You will work independently and within a team environment, collaborating on tasks performed across a spectrum of disciplines and have excellent writing and oral presentation skills.

Tasks may include but not limited to:

  • Lead the technical content, plans, processes, and reviews of the V&V program throughout the Mass Change Project lifecycle, including providing insight/oversight of the V&V efforts by the JPL in-house team, flight system contractor Airbus (Germany), and international partner German Aerospace Center (DLR).

  • Track, manage, and report progress of Project's verification & validation activities and requirements closeout to institutional and project management, and at major reviews,

  • Be responsible for and ensure execution of the correct rigor of V&V throughout the Project, including its proper evidencing and traceability in project's database,

  • Analyze venues to define sufficient capability and fidelity for the V&V program,

  • Own the technical challenges to V&V from an end-to-end perspective for the entire Project, and adjust the V&V program to meet those challenges and reduce risk to an acceptable level,

  • Set overall V&V strategic prioritization and work with other V&V Leads, Venue Managers, and Lead SEs to determine tactical priority.

  • Lead the development of project- and system-level V&V products and activities; plan and execute V&V reviews and audits, and lead the closure of V&V portions of the Certification of Flight Readiness (CoFR) deliveries.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Physics, or related technical discipline with a minimum of 9 years of professional work experience, or Master’s degree with a minimum of 7 years of professional work experience, or Ph.D with a minimum of 5 years of professional work experience.

  • System V&V or I&T experience with flight projects, and in particular with a major system contractor, during spacecraft assembly, integration, test and launch preparations (Phase C/D).

  • Significant knowledge of mission scenario development and use in mission scenario testing.

  • Significant knowledge of the function and operation of spacecraft systems and subsystems.

  • Experience with development and delivery of system documentation (requirements, design description documents, test plans, and test reports).

  • Experience making technical/risk trades or advising management on such trades.

  • Availability for occasional domestic travel, and travel to each major design review.

Preferred Skills:

  • Demonstrated subject matter expert at the group level or higher in Systems Engineering or V&V and has served as a team lead or CAM in Systems Engineering or V&V with a successful track record for at least one year.

  • Proven ability to lead the activities of and to synthesize the unique discipline knowledge of a broad range of technical subject matter experts.

  • Experience leading tasks and coordinating working groups on large-scale projects in system development, test, and/or operations.

  • Experience delivering hardware or software to a set schedule and budget.

  • Willingness to obtain a security clearance if asked.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
